japanese:
さーて！
お昼ご飯もすんだし、
フータロー君、このあとはどうする予定？
translation:
Right, then!
We've eaten lunch,
Futaro-kun, what do you want to do after this?

japanese:
いや、特に考えてなかった。
海水浴なんだし泳げばいいんじゃないか？
translation:
Oh, I can't really think of anything.
We could go for a dip in the ocean, right?

japanese:
上杉さん！
海といえばやっぱりスイカ割りですよ、
スイカ割りしましょう！
translation:
Uesugi-san!
Speaking of the ocean,
I think we should do watermelon splitting! Let's do it!

japanese:
でもスイカなんてないじゃない。
ビーチボールあたりで代用するの？
translation:
But we don't have any watermelons, do we?
Are we gonna use a beach ball instead?

japanese:
ジャ～ン！
なんとスイカを発見しちゃったんだ。
ちゃんと冷やしておいたから、超食べ頃だよ。
translation:
Tah-dah!
I somehow found a watermelon.
I properly chilled it, so it's totally ready to eat.

japanese:
は？　これスイカなの？
見た目スイカっぽくなくない？
translation:
Huh? This is a watermelon?
It isn't a watermelon I've seen before.

japanese:
あれ？　上杉さん？
五月も真剣な顔してどうしたの？
translation:
Huh? Uesugi-san?
Itsuki too, you look so serious. What happened?

japanese:
上杉君はどう思います？
これは本当にスイカなのでしょうか？
translation:
What do you think, Uesugi-kun?
Is this a real watermelon?

japanese:
どうかな、品種まではわからないが
ウリ科の実なのは確かだろう。
translation:
I wonder, I can't tell what species it is,
but it's certainly a fruit of the gourd family.

japanese: 食べて大丈夫でしょうか？
translation: Is it alright to eat?

japanese: あ、あのー？　２人とも？
translation: U-um? You two?

japanese:
正体がわからないなら食べなければいいだけだ。
せっかくの食材だが腹を壊しても困るしな。
translation:
If you don't know what it is, you mustn't eat it.
It's nice we might have found something to eat,
but I don't want anyone to get sick to their stomach.

japanese:
それもそうですね。
背に腹は変えられませんし。
translation:
That's true, indeed.
You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs.

japanese:
そのことわざ、用法を間違えてるぞ。
あとで正しい意味を調べておけ。
translation:
That's not how that proverb is used.
Please learn the correct way to use it.

japanese:
ま、まあまあ！
細かいことは割ったあとで考えませんか？
translation:
W-well, anyway!
Let's think about the details
after we've split it, okay?

japanese:
早くしないと、せっかく冷えたスイカが
あったまっちゃうよ！
translation:
If we don't hurry, the chilled watermelon
will warm right up!

japanese: 割るのは誰がやる？
translation: Who is going to try splitting it first?

japanese:
うーん、ここはやっぱり上杉さんで
いいんじゃないかな？
translation: Hmm, I think Uesugi-san should start.

japanese:
お前たちの誰かでいいじゃないか。
なんで俺がやるんだ？
translation:
Why don't one of you start?
Why do I have to do it?

japanese: 私の力じゃ、割るのはちょっと無理。
translation: I can't do it. I'm not strong enough.

japanese:
そうですね。
ここは唯一の男性である、あなたにお任せします。
translation:
That's right.
We'll leave it up to the only boy around here.

japanese:
私、フー君の格好いいところが見たいな。
頑張って！
translation:
I want to see you look cool, Fu-kun.
Do your best!

japanese:
まあ、割れなきゃ意味がないしな。
仕方がない、俺がやってやるか。
translation:
Well, there's no point if we don't split it.
It can't be helped, I'll give it a shot.

japanese:
妙に張り切ってますね。
実はやりたかったのですか？
translation:
Wow, aren't you confident.
You actually wanted to do it, didn't you?

japanese: い、いいだろ別に！　夏の醍醐味だ！
translation:
Wh-who cares if I want to!
It's classic summer fun!

japanese:
四葉がやればいいんじゃないか？
スイカを用意したのは四葉なんだし。
translation:
I think you should do the honors, Yotsuba.
You're the one that prepared the watermelon after all.

japanese:
いえいえ、私よりも上杉さんのほうが
適役だと思いますよ。
translation:
No no, I think you're more suitable than I am,
Uesugi-san.

japanese:
なんだよ適役って……
それで本当に俺がやってもいいんだな？
translation:
Suitable...? 
You sure you want me to do it?

japanese:
はい、ここはビシッと
格好よく決めちゃってください！
translation:
Yeah! Just CRACK that thing open!
With style!

japanese:
仕方がない。
見てろよ、一発で決めてやるからな。
translation:
Okay, then.
Check this out. I'll finish this in one shot.

japanese:
妙に張り切ってますね。
実はやりたかったのですか？
translation:
Wow, aren't you confident.
You actually wanted to do it, didn't you?

japanese: い、いいだろ別に！　夏の醍醐味だ！
translation:
Wh-who cares if I want to!
It's classic summer fun!

japanese: らいは、やってみるか？
translation: Raiha, want to give it a shot?

japanese:
え～？
みんなはお兄ちゃんの格好いいとこを
見たいんじゃないかな？
translation:
Huh?
I think everybody wants to watch you do it, big bro.

japanese:
うんうん、フータロー君なら、
ビシッと一発で決めてくれそうだもんね。
translation:
Yeah yeah, if you do it, Futaro-kun,
I think you'd split it open with one blow.

japanese: フータロー、頑張って。
translation: Futaro, do your best.

japanese:
ほらね？
お兄ちゃんファイトファイト！
translation:
Look, see?
Big bro, fight, fight!

japanese:
よーし、やるからには一発で決めてやるからな。
お前らも、しっかり見ておけよ！
translation:
Alriiight, if I'm going to do this, better do it
in one shot.
You'd better watch too, girls!

japanese:
妙に張り切ってますね。
実はやりたかったのですか？
translation:
Wow, aren't you confident.
You actually wanted to do it, didn't you?

japanese: い、いいだろ別に！　夏の醍醐味だ！
translation:
Wh-who cares if I want to!
It's classic summer fun!

japanese:
はい、フータロー君。
目隠しするからじっとしてねー。
translation:
Alright, Futaro-kun.
I'll blindfold you, so hold still.

japanese: おう。
translation: Okay.

japanese:
んっ……と。
こんな感じでいいかな？　縛り方、キツくない？
translation:
And...there.
How is it? Did I tie it on too tight?

japanese:
問題ない。
しかしマジで何も見えねぇな、これで割るのか。
translation:
No problem.
But I really can't see anything at all.
I wonder if I can actually split it.

japanese: ふふ、本当に見えないのかしら？
translation: Teehee, you really can't see, can you?

japanese: 二乃、くっつきすぎ。
translation: Nino, leave him alone.

japanese: おい、なにしてんだ？
translation: Hey, what are you doing?

japanese:
はい、そこまでです！
早く始めますよ！
translation:
Alright, that's far enough, Nino!
Let's hurry up and start!

japanese:
じゃあ、いま上杉さんが立っているところが
スタート地点として……スイカを置いてきまーす。
translation:
Okay, let's say where Uesugi-san is standing now
is the starting point...
and I'll put the watermelon here.

japanese:
準備オッケー？
それじゃ、スタート！
translation:
Are you ready?
GO!

japanese: よし、行くぞ！
translation: Right, here I go!

japanese: 左よ、左！
translation: To the left, to the left!

japanese: もっと右、右～！
translation: Right, more to the right!

japanese: そのまま真っ直ぐです！
translation: Okay, go straight, just like that!

japanese: 向き、違ってる。
translation: You're going the wrong way.

japanese: 頑張れ～！
translation: Do your best!

japanese: いい感じですよ！
translation: You're doing well!

japanese: はあ！？
translation: WHAA?!

japanese: ほら右だってば、もっと右！
translation: I said, RIGHT, didn't I? Go right more!

japanese: 左、左に戻って！
translation: Go left, go back to the left!

japanese: 前に進まないと始まりませんよ！
translation: You won't get anywhere if you don't go straight!

japanese: そこでジャンプ！　ジャンプ！
translation: Jump there! Jump!

japanese: おろおろしてるフー君、ちょっと可愛い。
translation:
Fu-kun is kinda cute when he's flustered like this,
isn't he.

japanese: 違います！　あっちですよ、あっち！
translation: You're wrong! Go THAT way! THAT way!

japanese: ちょっとタイムだ！　タイム！
translation: Hold on, time out! Time out!

japanese: あらら、もう降参？
translation: Oh my, giving up already?

japanese:
一斉にしゃべられたら聞き取れねぇぞ！
今の指示でどうやって進めって言うんだ、
割らせる気ないだろ！
translation:
If you all speak at once, I can't make sense
of anything! How am I supposed to reach the
watermelon? You just don't want me to split it, right?

japanese: 偶然よ、ぐ・う・ぜ・ん。
translation: That's a coincidence, a COINCIDENCE!

japanese: 五つ子ならではのチームワークってやつですね！
translation: It's a special kind of teamwork unique to quintuplets!

japanese:
はあ……。
とにかく、指示出しするのは２人くらいにしてくれ。
でないと割れる未来が見えてこない。
translation:
*sigh*
Anyway, can I get instructions come from just two
of you, okay? If not, I may never be able to split it.

japanese:
上杉君の言うことも一理ありますね。
割れてもらわないと困りますし。
translation:
Uesugi-kun has a point.
If he doesn't split it, we'll be in trouble.

japanese: 食べられないもんね。
translation: We won't be able to eat it.

japanese: じゃあ指示出し、誰がやる？
translation: Okay, then who will give instructions?

japanese:
ジャンケンにしましょ。
勝ち残った２人が、フー君に指示を出せるの。
translation:
Let's decide with rock-paper-scissors.
The two winners get to instruct Fu-kun.

japanese: じゃあ、いくよー！
translation: Alright, here we go!

japanese: せーの！
translation: Rock, paper, SCISSORS!
